title: U.A.E.’s New Western Workweek Upsets Friday Brunch
sub_head: Gulf state switches to Monday through Friday schedule, changing weekend plans; ‘Monday mornings are now the bad mornings’
body:
DUBAI—Mounia Touhami used to love working Sundays, the first day of the workweek in the United Arab Emirates. The U.S. and Europe were off for the weekend, and the financier had a quiet day to get things done.
Now, her adopted country is switching to match the rest of the world with a Monday to Friday week, starting Jan. 1. The French expatriate fears she’ll work six days a week as clients in other Gulf countries continue to work Sunday through Thursday, and her colleagues in the West pester her on a Friday.
